work.name: The Cincinnati Insurance Company
highlights: Led a collaborative research project with Ohio State University leveraging language modeling for homeowner pricing: applied DPO to rank zip-code-level risk, and used LLM-based summarization and embedding of demographic, social media, and crime data for territory-level risk tiering.
Led development of an Azure-hosted GPT-based assistant using RAG, enabling underwriters to query predictive models, documentation, and risk factors via natural language.
Improved territory factor modeling by introducing graph-based smoothing and clustering methods inspired by Graph Neural Networks, integrating spatial, locational, and demographic information.
Designed and deployed a predictive model to identify policies requiring inspection; contributed approximately $1M in annual premium uplift.
Conducted large-scale feature analysis across 1,000+ candidate variables to identify robust predictors for homeowner rating and underwriting models.
